intro: Antidesma subcordatum var. genuinum, commonly known as the African starfruit or sour starfruit, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves that are often arranged opposite on the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by bright orange or red, fleshy fruits that are edible when ripe. Its fruits are typically sour and used in local cuisines, while the plant also has traditional medicinal uses. The species is often found in woodland areas and along riverbanks, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
